_header: As I gan wander in my walking / Besides an holt…
Subjects: vanity, against worldly; human life, transitory nature of; transitoriness, of life
_description: The Hours of Man’s Life — ten 8-line stanzas with the refrain: ‘þis worlde is but a vanyte’

BodLatMisE85.First Lines:
As I wanderd in my walkyngbe syde an holt wondyr an
                    hyll…
BodLatMisE85.Last Lines:
…bot good and yll I may hueþis world ys bot a
                    wanite
BodLatMisE85.Attributed Author: Explicit [?tautus] quod de Thomas Peny OP (f. 82); also ‘ houghton’ after title, same folio (possibly scribe)
BodLatMisE85.Attributed Title: Þis world ys bot a wanite (f. 82)

NLWPork10.Note: With an extra stanza between stanzas 1 & 2.
NLWPork10.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard. 
             Early English Miscellanies in Prose and Verse.
         London: for the Warton Club, 1855: 9-12.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 230-3.

Lam853.First Lines:
AS Y Gan wandre in my walkingeBisidis an holt vndir an hilleY
                    say an oolde man sitte wepingeWith siȝynge sore he seide me
                    tille…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Þus an oold man y herde mornyngeBiside an holte vndir a
                    treeGod graunte us his blis euerlastingeÞis world is but a
                    vanite

Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The History of the Holy Grail by Henry Lovelich.
